enablefeatures.name: enablefeatures
enablefeatures.description:
enablefeatures(int) - Enables specific client features based on a feature flag bitmask.

Use `allfeatures` to get all features, then subtract specific feature values to disable them. 

`1` = M key (map),
`2` = P key (pause)
`4` = Q key (weapon select)
`8` = R key (show ratings)
`0x10` = S+A drop items
`0x20` = S+D switch weapons 
`0x40` = TAB key
`0x80` = chat text display
`0x100` = hearts over player heads
`0x200` = nicknames
`0x800` = right-click profile
`0x1000` = emoticons
`0x8000` = F2 output (savelog/echo)

showstats.name: showstats
showstats.description:
TServerNPC.showstats | Controls which status bar elements are visible using flag values.

Use `allstats` to show all default elements, then subtract specific flags to hide them.

`0x1` = ASD
`0x2` = icons (for rupees, bombs, arrows)
`0x4` = rupees count
`0x8` = bombs count
`0x10` = arrows count
`0x20` = hearts
`0x40` = AP bar
`0x80` = MP bar
`0x100` = minimap
`0x200` = inventory
`0x400` = player

DEPRECATED - TStaticVar.Sound.sound(params...) - returns object

Creates and returns a Sound object. Sound is a TStaticVar type used for sound effect management.

Note: This function appears to be deprecated as calling sound() results in "Function sound not found" errors in the console. Use play(), play2(), playlooped(), or playlooped2() instead for sound playback.

Use stopsound(str) to stop a sound effect by filename.

WorldsF.getControlBinding.description: Gets control binding information from the F3 Options menu Keys tab. First argument is the action (0=up, 1=left, 2=right, 3=down, 4=sword, 5=bomb, 6=arrow, 7=run, 8=strafe, 9=sneak, 10=pause). Second argument is the binding index (0-2) for that action. Returns TControlBinding object with properties: action, keycode, keytext, slot.

Adventure_invokeMouseEvent.name: Adventure_invokeMouseEvent
Adventure_invokeMouseEvent.description:
Adventure_invokeMouseEvent(int, int, int, int, double, double, int, bool) - Invokes a mouse event.

`int` - Button ID (0 = no button, 1 = left, 2 = right, 3 = middle)
`int` - X coordinate (integer)
`int` - Y coordinate (integer)
`int` - Modifier flags (0 = none, 1 = shift, 2 = ctrl, 3 = alt)
`double` - X coordinate (floating point, for precise positioning)
`double` - Y coordinate (floating point, for precise positioning)
`int` - Wheel delta (scroll amount for wheel events, 0 for other events)
`bool` - Pressed state (true = button down, false = button up; only used for button events)

GuiControl.description: GuiControl is the base GUI control, therefore general functions listed here are available to all GUI controls. Most of the time it is used as container for positioning groups of other controls. It can either have a border (border=1..5) or just be plain transparent, and just display its child controls.
